data.title: the BEST bagels ever
data.text:
the bagels are excellently prepared, and very, very fresh. plus, tasty! on top of that the service at this location is wonderful. both Jenna and Breeze are friendly and especially helpful. wish we had one of these in our home town. but whenever in Pittsburgh will certainly stop back in. 
AND - in additional to breakfast bagels, they offer a variety of lunch options, too.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Stopped in here before leaving to travel 4 hrs home. Awesome food! It was a busy early morning and they were great of getting everyone's orders out in a timely fashion. Even when the guy beside us ordered dozens of bagels. That didn't slow anything down.

data.title: Healthy choices
data.text: I haven't been there for awhile. Love the expanded facility and heathy options. Coffee better than Starbucks and service was quick. I only had a toasted Everything bagel and coffee. Very clean and friendly staff.

data.title: So So So Slow Service
data.text:
I had a taste for a bagel this morning so walked into Brueggers.  It is nicely remodeled and has a terrific juice bar along with bagels.  It was around 8:15 and probably 6 people in front of me.  The line never moved for over 5 minutes... And it took nearly 15 minutes to serve 6 people with coffee and bagel orders... I was ready to leave, but decided to wait.
Finally I placed my order and waited. And waited. And waited.  I only ordered an everything bagel with light cream cheese, not toasted.  Took another 8 minutes and honestly, was pretty frustrated.  The place wasn't even hopping so disappointed at the very slow service.
I did like the bagel though.. It was delicious...

data.title: Saturday Afternoon Bagel Stop
data.text: We stopped for lunch around 2pm. The place was completely empty. I didnt find the menu to be anything special. I got a standard bacon, egg, and cheese bagel sandwich. The food was good. I would have preferred more/better options of menu items.

data.title: Great breakfast bagels!...
data.text: We ate here for breakfast while staying in the Omni William Penn Hotel, and were delighted each time.  The bagels are very fresh, and the fresh squeezed orange juice was a treat!

data.title: Bagels Plus More In Concourse B
data.text:
While waiting for a noon departure out of Concourse B on American Airlines, I was looking for something to eat for brunch. There weren't many choices, but this location had quick and friendly service.

There are 11 varieties of bagels with 12 flavors if cream cheese and 6 spreads including hummus.  They also offer a variety of breakfast sandwiches, regular sandwiches, soups and even burgers.

I went with the Barnyard Burger that included beef burger, swiss cheese, bacon and egg on an Asiago Bagel.  You can have your selections on either bread or bagels by the way.  

There were lots of drinks in a cooler including smoothies.  There were several tables plus a shelf bar against the wall with chairs and outlets for recharging electronics.  It is also a good choice if you are on the go and taking your food with you.

data.title: Like the bagels but service needs improvement
data.text: I always like Bruegger's, and the bagels were good here. The staff kept making mistakes, however, which was a little annoying when you're trying to get moving in the a.m.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: Love the cinnamon sugar bagel.  The hazelnut coffee was very hot but also great.  Very busy on a Monday morning.

data.title: Really good breakfast sandwiches
data.text: Didn't have a lot of time to eat, service very quick and efficient.  Staff seemed really happy to take care of me.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: We walked to Brueggar's in Market square mid-morning on a Saturday. They were busy but it still only took a few minutes wait for our bagels & drinks. This was an affordable breakfast option as the Wyndham near Point Park only had $$$ breakfast or room-service. The bagels were delicious, the restaurant was clean and the staff was friendly.

data.title: Great deal!
data.text: On Monday, you can get 2 coffees, 2 bagel toppers, and 13 bagels for $6! That was the cheapest thing we found in our area.

data.title: Good bagels, coffee so so (apart from irish spiced)
data.text:
Good selection of bagels, the current bacon, egg and brie special is nice. Service is a bit hit and miss but you expect that from a chain store , downtown was better than market square.

They seem to have trouble cutting all the way my through the bagels at either store, had to take one back as I couldn't break it apart.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: Really enjoyed this place....excellent soup...fabulous egg snadwich with gouda, apple, amd bacon...yummy toasted bagel with cream cheese....fresh brewed ice tea.....friendly helpful staff...great place to take a break from the conference...

data.title: Breakfast Was Good On Sunday Morning
data.text: Accessed from inside the hotel was good choice for early morning coffee and then walk outside while not raining. Food was good. Typical for the chain.

data.title: Good Bagels, Convenient Location
data.text: This Bruegger's had an access from the Omni William Penn Hotel. This made it convenient for breakfast. Since there were three of us, I thought I would get the three bagel special. That was supposedly cheaper than ordering individual bagels. Apparently, there is an extra charge to add cream cheese. The bagels magically became cream cheese sandwiches. That definitely was not any cheaper.

data.title: As expected but no more.
data.text: A good bagel but not overwhelmed. The smokes salmon cream cheese was edible but somehow too sweet tasting. Clearly used to Montreal bagels. These don't quite match up.

data.title: Best Bagels Ever!
data.text: Love Brueggers!!! I eat there whenever I find one!  Cinnamon Sugar bagel with honey walnut cream cheese is the BOMB!  Please open a store in Arlington TX!!!!

data.title: Nice Brueggers.
data.text: Good location, good service and great bagels - I would go back. The staff was very helpful and answered all of our silly questions.

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: I stop here at least once a week for breakfast. The coffee is good and I enjoy a simple egg and cheese bagel. It is not gummy like many breakfast places.
